channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Steve Bruce is the first manager to reveal clear details of what was discussed at last week's Project Restart meeting.
item.title: 'Most managers' oppose June 12 Premier League resumption

item.description: PBS FM brekky DJ Milo Eastwood is sorry for singing Get What You Give too loudly at 2am. And he really wants you to donate.
item.title: Community radio broadcasts SOS as sponsorships vanish

item.description: Hoang Pham displayed formidable technique and depth of feeling at his Melbourne Digital Concert Hall recital.
item.title: A masterclass in passionate piano: Pham delivers Chopin

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: Most church denominations apart from the Catholic faith have decided against reopening for 10 people.
item.title: 'Every person counts': Sydney churches reopen

item.description: In the first of two addresses for US graduates, former president Barack Obama has says some of his country's leaders are not even pretending to be in charge.
item.title: Obama tells graduates the coronavirus pandemic has torn back the curtain on US government

item.description: A solo pilot has died after crashing his home-built amphibious light plane into a backyard in the NSW Hunter region.
item.title: Man dead after 'home-built' light plane crashes in Hunter

item.dc:creator: John Bailey
item.description: An exhibition of art by incarcerated Indigenous Australians can be a turning point for the hundreds it showcases.
item.title: Out of prison and into worldwide artistic exhibition

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: The Supercars championship is set to return to action in Sydney in late June, with 11 more rounds in a championship that will straddle 2020 and 2021.
item.title: Green light for Supercars as Sydney return planned for late June

item.description: The German photographer's early portraits of the Beatles in Hamburg helped define their tough but sensitive image.
item.title: Photographer Astrid Kirchherr, who helped create the Beatlesâ€™ image, dies at 81

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Representatives of eight VFL clubs will meet the AFL again this week as they attempt to develop a plan that could see the state league competition continue in some form in 2020.
item.title: Eight teams could be enough for VFL to restart

item.description: This is the fundamental difference, which few care to consider: James and Jordan are icons from the same sport, but they have never played the same game.
item.title: The LeBron-Jordan debates miss the point. They are too different to compare

item.description: One of the most wanted fugitives in Rwanda's 1994 genocide has been arrested in Paris, authorities say.
item.title: Top fugitive in Rwanda's genocide arrested in Paris

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: Geelong midfielder Jack Steven has been seriously injured and is in hospital following a stabbing incident on Saturday night.
item.title: Police investigating serious injury to AFL footballer Jack Steven

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: Arthur Summons, one of two players immortalised on the NRL trophy with Norm Provan, has died at the age of 84.
item.title: Rugby league mourns passing of 'Gladiator' Summons

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: Rugby league's most famous photograph was on the reject pile until a canny Sun-Herald editor took one last look.
item.title: From the archive: How the iconic 'Gladiators' photo almost never saw the light of day

item.description: London specialists made the discovery after finding COVID-19 caused potentially deadly blood clots in the lungs of most patients who die.
item.title: Drugs to thin blood found to reduce virus deaths

item.dc:creator: Broede Carmody
item.description: The last three years have been an uphill battle for the national drive hosts.
item.title: 'Start to relax and have fun': KIIS FM re-signs Will and Woody

item.description: Democrats assert that Secretary of State Mike Pompeo recommended firing the Inspector General because he "had opened an investigation into wrongdoing by Secretary Pompeo himself".
item.title: Democrats launch probe of Trump's firing of watchdog

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: The federal government has provided a three-step roadmap to start carefully relaxing limits on our movement. Here's how each state is easing its coronavirus restrictions.
item.title: COVID-19: What are the public health rules now?

item.description: Live PGA golf returns to television on Sunday, and it might not look entirely familiar except for the players.
item.title: Golf returns to TV with a different look

item.dc:creator: John Shand
item.description: The name of this student band suggests the members know their ultimate goal.
item.title: Reaching for the stratosphere of music beyond thinking

item.description: Italy is making a bold bid to reboot its economy, with bars, restaurants, shops, museums and galleries to reopen.
item.title: Italy reopens borders to tourists, scraps quarantine period

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: Venues will be allowed to serve up to 20 customers from June 1, 50 patrons from June 22, and up to 100 in mid-July.Â
item.title: Pubs, cafes, restaurants to allow patrons to dine in from June 1

item.description: Despite the stream dropping out occasionally, this gig is one of the best productions yet of the local live-stream era.
item.title: Finger-clickin' good

item.description: It's soccer, but not as we know it. It's back, and while it looks and sounds very different, and will not be anything like as enjoyable to watch, it will do for now.
item.title: Bundesliga's return shows the soulless 'new normal'

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The 33-year-old senior constable from the southern region was also accused of accessing confidential information.
item.title: Queensland cop stood down amid domestic violence probe

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Trade Minister Simon Birmingham has revealed his counterpart in China is not returning his calls amid major trade tensions over beef and barley and has warned Australian businesses may now consider China too risky.
item.title: Chinese trade minister not returning calls amid beef, barley dispute

item.description: Borussia Dortmund crushed Ruhr rivals Schalke 4-0 on Saturday to move within one point of leaders Bayern Munich as the German Bundesliga returned from a two-month suspension due to the coronavirus outbreak.
item.title: Dortmund run riot as Bundesliga returns

item.description: Homicide detectives were flown to the Kimberley town on Friday and arrested the man on Saturday.
item.title: Homicide squad charge Kimberley man with murder

item.description: The Australian tennis star gave plenty of entertaining views in a late night Instagram chat with Andy Murray.
item.title: Kyrgios swipes Djokovic with Murray in late-night live chat

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: One man is dead and the other in critical condition after being rushed to hospital by a friend in Melbourne's north.
item.title: One man dead and one critical as homicide squad investigates

item.description: Willard spent three seasons on Everybody Loves Raymond, earning three Emmy Award nominations.
item.title: Fred Willard, master comic who starred in Everybody Loves Raymond, dead at 86

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Morrison government locks in COVID-19 independent review with EU support as global cases top 4.5 million, Australian death toll at 98

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Zach Hope
item.description: Rich lister Larry Kestelman has clawed back millions from investors who have failed to pay up for one of Melbourne's most glittering developments.
item.title: Buyers fail to pay up in glittering South Yarra mega development

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: COVID-19 has claimed the mayor of a French town long associated with Australia.
item.title: Farewell to a good friend taken by coronavirus

item.dc:creator: Steven Hamilton
item.description: The last thing anyone needs is to have the government pull the rug out from under them.Â
item.title: Scheme is flawed but JobKeeper promises need to be honoured

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: Two large surveys are investigating how we are sharing the load at home during isolation.
item.title: COVID and domestic dissonance: 'The aim is equality with your wife â€“ not your dad'

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Since Scott Morrison effectively closed our borders on March 20, we have been left with a tableau of Australian life in the Year 2020. Frozen in time. And we have a rare opportunity to stand back and study exactly how we are constituted.
item.title: Coronavirus pandemic gives us a chance to take stock on immigration

item.description: I have received messages from friends regarding Australians being confined to their homes and how they might begin to understand refugees' incarceration.
item.title: As I learn to live in freedom, Australia is still tormenting refugees

item.description: The pandemic has only served to reinforce deep inequities in the education system.
item.title: Every student deserves a fair go

item.dc:creator: Tony Wright
item.description: Victoria and NSW are now sharply divided about what should be done to control wild horse numbers in alpine regions.
item.title: All the pretty horses and all the damage done

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: The departure of two public figures who have made comments involving violence against women could be viewed as a time for advocates to rejoice, but it's not.
item.title: Maybe mocking violence against women isn't so acceptable after all

item.dc:creator: Danny Weidler
item.description: Greg Inglis has opened up about his own mental health issues in a bid to address some of the disgraceful commentary surrounding James Robertsâ€™ stint in rehab.
item.title: 'He should be proudâ€™: Message to Roberts as Inglis steps up for a mate in need

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: The NRL has overhauled the refereeing ranks. Now attention has turned to transforming how the bunker will be used.
item.title: Bunker down: Players drive bold plan to reduce reliance on video referee

item.description: Is there any future in swiping right when you are exposed to a tirade of abuse?
item.title: Online dating: When the language of 'love' is toxic

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: The hospitality sector could begin a staged reopening with testing data buoying government hopes that community transmission is low.
item.title: Pubs, restaurants and cafes set to reopen within weeks

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: Victorians flocked to parks and beaches to enjoy new freedoms on the first weekend after lockdown rules were eased.
item.title: 'Freedom day' sees Melburnians cautiously bask in May sun as restrictions ease

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: As schools prepare to welcome students full time by month's end, there are concerns about how the transport network will cope
item.title: Full-time school to put extra pressure on transport, roads

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Deputy Premier says he still has some fight left in him after his bruising byelection stoush with Andrew Constance.
item.title: 'I was terrified': Barilaro's epiphany could bring a change of heart
